meanings.definition: Institute legal proceedings against (a person or organization).
meanings.sent1: The lawyer prosecuted the criminal in court.
meanings.sent2: The district attorney prosecuted the case with determination.
meanings.sent3: The prosecutor prosecuted the case so well that even the judge was impressed.
meanings.sent4: The legal team prosecuted the case like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The attorney prosecuted the case with such skill that it left a lasting impression on everyone.

meanings.definition: Continue with (a course of action) with a view to its completion.
meanings.sent1: She prosecuted her plan to start a new business.
meanings.sent2: The team prosecuted the project until it was successfully completed.
meanings.sent3: He prosecuted his goal of running a marathon with unwavering determination.
meanings.sent4: The student prosecuted his study schedule like a dedicated scholar.
meanings.sent5: The chef prosecuted the recipe until it turned out perfectly delicious.
